Player History
Drafted in 3rd round, 53rd overall pick, by Texas in 1965...
Released by Texas on 3/2/1965...
Signed as a free agent by New York (N) on 3/2/1965 to a minor league deal...
Injured on 6/5/1966 with a Inflamed Hip Muscle, out for 5 days...
Injured on 8/8/1966 with a Bruised Hand, out for 2 days...
Traded from New York (N) to Chicago (N) on 2/13/1967 (Going to CHC: SS W. Garrett. Going to NYM: LF B. Williams)...
Had first career hit on 4/5/1967, off Ken T. Johnson (LA)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/9/1967, off Turk Farrell (PIT)...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1968...
Traded from Chicago (N) to Minnesota on 1/31/1970 (Going to CHC: P B. Cueto. Going to MIN: SS W. Garrett, P A. Hrabosky, P C. Acosta)...
Had 5 hits with 3 RBI against Texas on 4/6/1970...
Won Gold Glove Award at Shortstop in 1971...
Won Player of the Week award on 4/29/1972, hitting .560 with 1 HR, 3 RBI...
Injured on 6/10/1972 with a Ruptured Bicep Tendon, out for 3 weeks...
